summary: Build "DRAFT MASTER": an interactive legal drafting practice tool for a BALLB student focused on learning-by-doing (structure tutorials, guided drafting wizards, free drafting, and compare/improve feedback) across 8 legal draft types, with portfolio, skill scoring, scenario bank, clause/template libraries, gamification, and optional NEXUS mastery-sync; designed to work offline with autosave and exports.
architectural_notes: Offline-first web app with localStorage persistence for drafts, XP/level, skill scores, and completed/mastered draft types.
Export capability required: PDF and DOCX.
Mobile-responsive UI; can be implemented as a single HTML file or multi-file (e.g., template storage).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimalist "DRAFT MASTER" logo in a professional legal office style (draft-master-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Set of 8 achievement/badge icons in a cohesive style (badge-set-8.dim_256x256.png)
- Small app favicon mark derived from the logo (draft-master-favicon.dim_128x128.png)

existing_features.title: Create the core app shell for "DRAFT MASTER" with top-level navigation and routes for: Draft (choose draft type), Learn (structure/anatomy tutorials), Portfolio (saved drafts), Skills (skill scoring dashboard), and Settings. Ensure all user-facing text is in English.

Apply the specified "Professional Legal Office" visual design across the app: soft cream background (#f5f5dc), navy primary (#001f3f), burgundy secondary (#800020), deep green success (#2d5016), charcoal text (#36454f), gold accents (#b8860b); typography using Merriweather for headings, Source Sans Pro for UI/body, and Georgia for draft editor text; mobile-responsive layout.

Implement the 8 draft-type learning tracks organized into Phase 1 (Legal Notice, Loan Agreement, Rent Agreement, Service Agreement, Police Complaint/FIR, Bail Application) and Phase 2 (Plaint, Writ Petition). Provide a draft-type selection screen showing phase grouping and per-type status: NOT STARTED / IN PROGRESS / MASTERED.

For each draft type, implement the 4-step workflow: (1) Learn Structure tutorial, (2) Guided Drafting Wizard (Q&A) that generates an editable formatted draft, (3) Free Practice Mode (blank drafting from scenario), (4) Compare & Improve (side-by-side user vs model with detected issues and suggestions) with a refine-and-resubmit loop.

Build the Legal Notice content end-to-end as the reference implementation: an interactive anatomy/structure tutorial (with essential elements list) + an annotated model notice view; a Guided Wizard matching the provided Legal Notice question set (notice type, parties, contract description, breach, breach date, demand, amount) that generates a properly formatted notice; Free Practice scenario mode with the provided sample scenario; and Compare & Improve showing issues like missing deadline, weak demand language, and missing legal basis (as applicable).

Add a local, offline-first data layer using browser storage to persist: userXP, userLevel, achievements earned, per-draft-type progress, skillScores (structural, legal, factual, language, completeness), and draftPortfolio items (type, scenario metadata, draft text, score, date, feedback entries).

Implement a drafting editor experience for both wizard-generated and free-practice drafts, including: editable text area (rich text or structured plain text), autosave every 30 seconds to offline storage, explicit Save action, and Submit for Review action that creates a review attempt record.

Implement an automated feedback and scoring engine (no external AI services) that reviews a submitted draft against a per-draft-type checklist and model draft to produce: detected issues (e.g., missing required sections, weak/vague phrases, missing dates/amounts, formatting problems), improvement suggestions, positive feedback, a numeric overall score (0–10), and 5 sub-scores for the core skills (structural clarity, legal precision, factual accuracy, language quality, completeness).

Create the side-by-side "Your Draft vs Model Draft" comparison UI with highlighting for detected issues and quick actions: Refine Draft (returns to editor with current text), Save, and Try New (starts a new attempt for the same draft type/scenario). Model drafts must remain hidden until the user submits for review.

Build the Practice Scenarios Bank for each draft type with at least 5 scenarios per draft type and 3 difficulty levels (Basic/Intermediate/Advanced). Each scenario includes a full fact pattern and is selectable for Free Practice; each has an associated model draft used for comparison.

Create per-draft-type learning resources: Common Mistakes (top 10 with why/how-to-fix/examples) and a Checklist (“Did you include X?”). Integrate these into the Learn and drafting flows so the student can consult them while drafting.

Implement "My Draft Portfolio" showing drafts grouped by type, with per-draft score and date, totals and average score, and the ability to open a draft to view/edit/re-review. Add an "Export All" action that exports all saved drafts as a single PDF and also supports per-draft export to PDF and plain text.

Create the Skills dashboard showing visual progress bars for the 5 core drafting skills and an overall drafting proficiency percentage computed from recent submissions. Allow the user to see how each submission affected the skill scores (at least via a simple history list).

Add gamification: XP, levels (1–15 with the provided titles), and achievements with the provided names and triggers. Update XP and achievements based on actions: completing guided draft, completing free practice, scoring 9/10+, refining and improving, weekly challenge completion, and mastering all 8 draft types.

Implement mastery logic per draft type: consider a draft type "MASTERED" when the user scores at least 8/10 on 3 separate drafts of that type. Reflect mastery status throughout the UI, including the homepage-style progress summary for Phase 1 and Phase 2.

Add a Weekly Challenge feature: show the current weekly scenario (difficulty, description), allow "Accept Challenge", provide a dedicated drafting + submission flow, and award the specified XP plus a badge/achievement progress indicator when completed.

Add special practice modes: (a) Voice-to-text drafting using the browser’s speech recognition where available with graceful fallback when unsupported; (b) Timed drafting mode with a configurable default 30-minute timer and an exam-simulation UI that can be used in Free Practice and Weekly Challenge flows.

Implement collaborative review via share link: allow a user to generate a shareable link for a specific draft attempt; shared view allows others to add comments/suggestions (no real-time requirement). Ensure basic access control via an unguessable token in the URL and allow the owner to revoke sharing.

Add optional canister-backed sync endpoints to support shared links and (optionally) backup of drafts/progress while keeping offline-first behavior. The app must function fully without sign-in; if Internet Identity is used, it should only enhance cross-device sync and ownership of shared drafts.

Implement a Settings page with options to: reset all local data (with confirmation), export/import local data as a JSON file for backup, toggle voice-to-text features, and choose whether to enable online backup/sharing features.

Add NEXUS integration as an optional, user-configurable sync adapter: when a draft type becomes MASTERED in Draft Master (>=8/10 on 3 drafts), record a "mastery event" that can be exported (JSON) and/or sent to a configurable endpoint if the user provides one in Settings. Do not hardcode any external API URL.

Provide templates (blank formats) per draft type in-app and allow downloading those templates as plain text and PDF. Clearly label them as templates and keep them separate from the practice scenarios and model drafts.

Create a Clause Library with at least a starter set of standardized clauses organized by draft type and purpose, supporting copy-to-clipboard and insert-into-editor actions. Include the example clauses (Termination, Jurisdiction, Force Majeure) as part of the library.

Add a Before/After Gallery section showing at least a few examples of weak vs improved drafts with highlighted improvements (added clause, removed weak language, improved phrasing). Keep these as static learning examples (not user data).

Implement print-ready formatting for drafts: consistent margins, headings, and spacing suitable for legal documents; provide a "Print Preview" view for any draft and ensure exported PDFs use the same formatting.

Generate and include static visual assets for the app (logo and a small set of badges/icons) under frontend/public/assets/generated, and render them in the UI (logo in header/home, badges in achievements/challenges).

new_feature_requests.summary: Support 8 draft-type learning tracks (Phase 1: Legal Notice, Loan Agreement, Rent Agreement, Service Agreement, Police Complaint/FIR, Bail Application; Phase 2: Plaint, Writ Petition)
Four-step learning workflow per draft type: Structure tutorial → Guided drafting wizard → Free practice mode → Compare & improve against model with feedback and scoring
Interactive structure/anatomy tutorials with annotated model drafts
Guided drafting wizard (TurboTax-style Q&A) that generates an editable, properly formatted draft
Free practice mode with blank template + scenario prompt, submission for review, and autosave
Side-by-side comparison view (user draft vs model) with AI-highlighted issues, suggestions, and resubmission loop
Practice scenario bank (50+), with difficulty levels and model drafts hidden until submission
Per-draft-type common mistakes database + checklists for required elements
Draft portfolio/library: save, view, edit, re-practice; show counts, average scores; export all
Skill tracking dashboard scoring 5 skills (structural clarity, legal precision, factual accuracy, language quality, completeness) with progress bars and overall proficiency
Clause library (100+ clauses) organized by draft type/purpose with copy-paste building blocks
Professional templates per draft type; downloads in Word/docx, plain text, and PDF
Before/after gallery showing weak vs improved drafts with highlighted improvements
Weekly challenge feature (complex scenarios) with rewards
Gamification: XP, levels, and achievements; mastery defined as 8/10+ and milestones (e.g., Phase 1 mastered)
NEXUS integration: mark draft type as MASTERED in NEXUS after scoring 8/10+ on 3 drafts of same type; sync progress
Special modes: voice-to-text drafting, timed drafting (exam simulation), collaborative review via share link/comments
Print-ready formatting with proper margins/letterhead and court-ready PDF export
Mobile-responsive UI with professional legal office theme (specified color scheme and fonts)
Offline-first storage using localStorage for drafts/progress, including autosave every 30 seconds
